website_summaries.verdict: Very similar to the FRAM, in design and in reviews. Cheaper than the FRAM, but also has fewer reviews commenting on the effectiveness of the baking soda.
pros: Contains baking soda and carbon to generate fresh air
cons: Gray carbon filter means it's difficult to visually inspect for dirt
Doesn't filter out as much vehicle exhaust as some customers would like

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad!
customer_reviews.text: Now I just installed the new filter so I don't know if I can tell they're same or better than the original dirty filter. But I'll assume the air will be fresher inside the cabin now. I'd rate it somewere between 4 & 5 stars! Pros: Exact part fit, easy to install on most Honda models, great value at 3 under $20! Activated charcol embedded in filter material Cons: Only one I see is there is much less filter material than OEM (see photo showing about half the bends), However, the material is THICKER than the original so the number of folds may be moo (e.g. you know, the cows don'r care)
customer_reviews.author: Sanders Prime

customer_reviews.title: Better then OEM at 1/3 the price.
customer_reviews.text: Cabin air filters are often overlooked. This is a inexpensive fix to keep your interior of your car from smelling like a locker room. I placed small drops of peppermint oil on the filter and it gives a hint of it when the AC or Heater is on.
customer_reviews.author: MAS

customer_reviews.title: Fit my CRV: To fit match the direction of pleats of replacement same as original, not the side labeled as 'Air Flow'
customer_reviews.text: This worked on my CRV. I was confused at first when I lined up the sides labeled 'Air flow' on the original and this replacement. They will seem to be different size if you do that! (First photo) However if I rotated the replacement 90 degree to make the pleats direction parallel, their sizes do match with one another (second photo). So, in the original the side with label 'Air Flow' was in front. After installing the replacement, the label goes on the right side. But I am sure it does not affect functionality. It is easy and quick to install by yourself.
customer_reviews.author: OhYeahOhYeah

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe it was so easy to replace cabin AIR filter
customer_reviews.text: Saved lot of $$s compared to dealer ... for engine AIR and Cabin AIR filter dealer was asking $200, was able to do it home for less than $25. Fits perfectly with 2010 Acura TL. Can't believe it was so easy to replace cabin AIR filter. Bought this based on ratings, see the picture the pleats are not as dense as OEM but time will tell the quality even if i change at 50% interval still saves lot of money...happy for now.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Dirt in the air
customer_reviews.text: The filters ability to thoroughly eliminate dust particles from entering into my 2009 Honda CRV and 2008 Honda Odyssey. Don't want dust mites in my cars. From "It Stills Runs" Prior to the advent of the cabin air filter, a lot of the dirt, dust and allergens from outside came inside the vehicle through the vents. This often left the vehicle's interior, and sometimes the passengers, coated in a fine layer of dust and dirt. The cabin filter changed all that, and today many vehicles have cleaner air than ever before.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: As Good AS OEM - Quick Easy Install
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect and tight into my 2003 Honda Acura. About as many pleats as the OEM. Second one I have bought - nice easy 2 minute job folks - don't pay the dealer $89...you don't even need a screwdriver for my model.....WOW....just make sure you look for air flow direction arrow before removing the old filter and understand correctly the arrow direction on the side of the filter to put it in right way...
customer_reviews.author: Telecaster

customer_reviews.title: Much better quality than I was anticipating.
customer_reviews.text: These are of much higher quality than some of the so called name brand filters and easily equal to the OEM that came with the car. Somehow we lived with air conditioned cars for decades without these but now they seem to be one more maintenance item to attend to so at least this is at a very reasonable price. One of the quick lube places tried to tell my wife it was $40 to replace this filter. Thankfully, even though it was filthy, she waited for me to order and install one of these.
customer_reviews.author: tom4416

customer_reviews.title: Change your cabin filter!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I figured I would try one of these filters. They aren't bad, but I would highly recommend the Fram Fresh Breeze cabin filter with baking soda, instead of this one. The Fram filter makes a HUGE difference in the quality of your cabin air. This filter works, but doesn't have the odor-reducing capability of the Fram filter. Regardless of which filter you choose, you should change your cabin filter at least annually, or even more often if you remember.
customer_reviews.author: joe v

customer_reviews.title: Buy these and put in yourself, don't overpay at a repair shop
customer_reviews.text: Local Honda dealer previously charged me $85 to change my in cabin air filter. Thank God for You-Tube. Changing in Honda Pilot was so easy (no tools), took 2 minutes. My existing filter was filthy and full of leaves and debris! Important note that after changing the filter my fan made a high pitched noise. Obviously could not be due to new filter, but had to use compressor and mini pliers to blow and pick out debris (from prior filter).
customer_reviews.author: sherm624

customer_reviews.title: Mountain Fresh Pristine Air Inside my Acura TL
customer_reviews.text: But seriously, what do you want me to say. It's just a filter. You might want to know just how easy these are to replace. Just snap out your glove box and pop in a new one (might need to take out one or two screws). It is a 5 minute job, really. Don't pay a dealer a bunch of money to do this.
customer_reviews.author: Anthonx

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit on 2008 Honda CRV LX
customer_reviews.text: Bought an 08 CRV LX with 54k miles and I don’t think the cabin air filter was ever replaced! These aftermarket cabin air filter replacements are a perfect fit in a ‘08 Honda CRV LX. The activated carbon is a nice feature. These are easy to replace. The replacement cartridge is behind the glovebox. Watch a video on how to do it. It literally takes a few minutes and can save you time and money over the dealership and garage costs. Just be careful when detaching the little plastic arm attached to the glovebox (it is easy to break!).
customer_reviews.author: Texas KnowHow

customer_reviews.title: Straightforward and video out there to help
customer_reviews.text: Car: Honda Accord(2015) My auto expertise level: Extremely low. Ability to follow instructions: High Match up my car with the filter type and ordered it. Shipping was easy and was packed very nice. I looked at a youtube video to know how to do it. Looked at it 3 times and then did it for the first time myself. Doing it yourself takes about 5 minutes at most. Saves you money from having an auto place do it. Saved me about $30. Easy decision. I would recommend anyone do it yourself and leave the more complicated things for the mechanic.
customer_reviews.author: manfresh

customer_reviews.title: Bare Bones
customer_reviews.text: 1. Best filter for your car? Nope. 2. Does it do the job? Yes, but not as adequate as I would’ve wanted. 3. Should you follow recommend miles on the box? To your discretion, I personally only used it for 3 months (less than 1,000 mi) before I realized I hated it. 4. Filters odor from outside? Nope. Odor seeps through. I personally don’t want to drown out the smell with car freshener. That’s just stacking odors together. 5. Recommend? Depends who’s asking. —— Need to be frugal? Yes, I recommend. —— Have a sensitive nose? No, I don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie

customer_reviews.title: Saved $100.00
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure the filter will do its job. The other reviews I have read about this product assures it. It does have arrow indicators to ensure you install it in the frame the correct way. The Honda dealership here in town wanted to charge me $130.00 to change the cabin filter and the motor air filter. I paid $28.00 for both. It took me 10 min. to change both. Amazon Prime, as usual, gave me free shipping and it came in two days. I will definitely purchase this filter again in a year. Do it your self. Thanks to youtube and the people who post DIY videos.
customer_reviews.author: OG

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality & Price!
customer_reviews.text: For whatever reason, I had neglected to replace my cabin filter for too long. With increased A/C usage with warmer temps, the cabin had taken a more noticeable stale smell. I was able to install this in our Acura MDX in <5 mins, and soon the cabin was smelling fresh again. For those of you who live in warmer climates and use your A/C on recirc often, you need to be replacing these every 6 months at a minimum. Super easy. Great quality at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Great find
customer_reviews.text: Nice, snug fit to the filter tray of my 2007 Acura TL. Did not notice any diminution in air flow even on low setting. I counted 29 pleats. Bear in mind that the material used is a bit thicker than the usual materials because the material here has to be substantial enough to hold carbon and baking soda. Thicker material in itself means fewer pleats. So there is a trade-off. Would definitely buy again. And will.
customer_reviews.author: Oakwheel

customer_reviews.title: Good quality! Look no further!
customer_reviews.text: What a difference. Wow! Install varies depends on the cars you install this in but overall it’s the same process. I bought a two pack for just under $13. I installed one inside my 2011 Honda CR-V and I installed the other in my 2010 Honda Odyssey. They both share the same filter size and these replacement filters fit perfectly. Why pay the dealer when you can do this at home in less than 5 mins? I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: DynamicReviews

customer_reviews.title: Fits! Seems to work OK!
customer_reviews.text: I mainly wanted to write a review on this just so that others were aware that this item fits like it says it will. I got this for our 2006 Honda Odyssey. Replacement was pretty straightforward, this filter fits just like the more expensive filters fit...and seemed as robust/heavy as those from other well known filter companies. No issues at all. Crazy to think that I almost spent $50 at an oil change place for them to replace something that cost less than $10 and took me all of 10 minutes to change (including 4 minutes of watching a youtube video of someone else doing it)
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.. easy installation
customer_reviews.text: Honda dealer told me it was time to replace the cabin air filter, and wanted over $60 to do it. That seemed like a lot, so I did some research. I found this for under $10, and found a U-Tube video which told me how to install it. Turns out to be REALLY easy. This fit just fine in my 2013 Odyssey and seems to work without any problems. I'd only use genuine Honda parts for critical drive train components, but why pay $50 more for a cabin air filter?
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Sacks

customer_reviews.title: Ordered Just in Time
customer_reviews.text: Been using these filters in our 2007 Honda Accord. Just got more a couple of months ago. We recently had a number of forest fires here in the Northwest and the filter kept out the heavy smoke smell from the interior. Once the fire smoke moved out, the heavy smoke smell was bad. Took out the filter to replace and found the used filter full of ashes. Once replaced, no more smoke smells. It was really surprising how much ash the filter stopped. Very pleased with these filters and can recommend them. None came with problems and always fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: MrEd

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and Fast Shipping
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new cabin filter quick as mice got into the engine compartment of my Honda Accord and deposited their poop on top of the battery, right next to the air intake. Needless to say, I needed to replace the cabin filter ASAP and this product was delivered within a couple of days. Problem solved. Discussing this incident with others taught me that many people don't even know they have a cabin filter! I usually replace mine about once every other year. It's the easiest car DIY project (about 2 minutes) I can think of.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Can feel the difference having the AC on in the Honda
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, our car dealers do not replace the air filter when we have our annual maintenance check with them. Five years later, we noticed the AC in our Honda was not getting cool air. After installing the Premium Cabin Air Filter, we noticed when putting the AC on in the car, it now blows cool air. It comes with a 2 Pack - EPAuto CP134 (CF10134) Premium Cabin Air Filter includes Activated Carbon. The air filter is very easy to install (instructions for unstalling/installing air filter is in the car manual).
customer_reviews.author: Orphan Annie

customer_reviews.title: DIY Filter
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a complete DIY when it comes to cars, but when a car place is going to charge you more than $50 to replace the cabin air filter, I'm all for DIY! This was exactly the part it said it was for, replaced easily in 30 seconds and I was done! Save yourself a mechanics bill and DIY!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Kubiszewski

customer_reviews.title: It has a bad odor, you smell dirt and debris when the ...
customer_reviews.text: It has a bad odor, you smell dirt and debris when the heater is on, my original Honda cabin filter never did that.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, easy to install, works well
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this cabin filter twice from this seller. It is easy to install in my 2014 Honda Odyssey EX-L. The filter is clearly labeled which way the air flows so you can install it properly. Note: install so the air flow arrow points down. The filter definitely works: the old filter had dust and debris resting on top (including small leaves and insects), so it's nice to know these contaminants remained outside the passenger compartment. Will buy again when it's time for the next cabin filter change.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher's Pet

customer_reviews.title: 2010 Honda Civic
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly and incredibly easy to install in my 2010 Honda Civic. 1) Take everything out of your glove compartment 2) Gently press in sides of glove compartment and it will lower fully to the ground 3) You will clearly see the air filter compartment 4) Remove the compartment and take out the old filter 5) Note the directional arrow for air flow on the compartment 6) Insert the new filter and slide the compartment back in 7) You're done
customer_reviews.author: Brent Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great product and very installation
customer_reviews.text: As mentioned in my video I have purchased this twice now for my 2014 Honda Accord and is very simple to replace. I hope people take the time to lookup how to replace the filter themselves rather than having a dealer do it because they rip people off save your money and buy this filter if it fits. This lasted close to 20K miles in my car I kind of paranoid about the cabin filter in my car and could have gone many more miles with it in but since its so cheap might as well and change it.
customer_reviews.author: Shamwow

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's designed to do
customer_reviews.text: There is absolutely no way I'm paying a dealership almost $90 for something I can do myself at lower cost. Parents - make sure your children who drive know how to change tires and filters and save $$$$. Even though my car is only a year old noticed a measurable difference in the AC once I changed filters. My daughter even bought this brand for her 2015 Honda Fit that had the original cabin filter!!! She said the same. Definitely worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R.

customer_reviews.title: Great filtration and air flow through the vents
customer_reviews.text: These EPAuto filters are great! Very well constructed relative to some other brands out there. I just replaced the factory filter on my car and the EPAuto is pretty much identical in terms of construction, fit, etc. I've been using these for many years in all my vehicles and am very pleased with the result. I honestly can't say much about the activated carbon in the filter but I just feel better knowing it's there. The air flow through the vents is the same as the OEM, so it's not constricting.
customer_reviews.author: SAERandy

customer_reviews.title: replacing this filter yourself saves you 90% of the Valvoline price
customer_reviews.text: When I was changing my oil, I got a $70+ quote for replacing the cabin filter. I rejected it and got this filter instead. At 1/10 of the price with active carbon, this is a bargain. It took me 3 minutes to replace it but this is because I have done it before. The first time I did it, i spent 20 minutes trying to figure out how to do it. Now it is way easier since you can find a YouTube videos that clearly demonstrate how is it done.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby M

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality. Cheaper to buy online.
customer_reviews.text: Just took out my old cabin filter. In comparison, that one was paper thin. The EPAuto brand is much better in quality, thicker and more well built. Immediately, I've notice better air quality and air flow. Installation is super easy. Definitely buying this brand again. Don't buy them at the store or from the mechanic, they rip you off. For example, $80 for a set of windshield wipers when I can get them for $30 on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money.  Fits many Honda’s.
customer_reviews.text: Got my oil changed today and they brought out my cabin air filter, which was disgusting by the way, and asked if I wanted it replaced. It was only gonna cost me an extra $40. Thanks but no thanks, just pop it back in I told them. Ordered this 2-pack on Prime. Delivered and installed a day and a half later in my Pilot and put the second one in my daughters Civic. Two cars done in 5 minutes for $12. Not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: randymac

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Note - this is a cabin air filter not an engine air filter You install this behind the glove compartment. It is very easy to do this, though - and on an Accord it takes minutes. Open the glove compartment and expose the area behind it. THen pull out the old tray by pushing the two clips in that hold it in and change out the filter. Tadaaa... I'm excited.. It will definitely give me clean breathing air.
customer_reviews.author: gumballmachine1

customer_reviews.title: Buy This One, Save Time & Money
customer_reviews.text: Exact duplicate of the OEM cabin filter being replaced. Air flow indicator on the side was clearly noticeable and legible. Once access area behind glove box was opened and filter housing reachable, the process to pull old and replace with new took approx. 30 seconds. Probably only took me 3-4 minutes to complete the whole task. I then charged myself $35.00 in labor for the replacement, just like the Honda Dealership wanted to charge me (plus the $22.00 for their filter). Buying a quality replacement like this one, changing it yourself, is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: San Diego Jack

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit Honda Odyssey
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit Honda Odyssey. Filter is too thick and sticks above the upper edge of the drawer. When tried to insert the drawer with the filter it goes 2/3 in and stops because the filter's upper edge hits two plastic ribs inside the "cabinet". Ended up taping the front edge of the filter on either side, along about 1/3 if the depth of the drawer to hold filter pushed down. It worked, but will not buy from this company again. It should work flawlessly without modification.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Clean Air!!!
customer_reviews.text: Clean Air for a great price!!! 2013 Honda Civic LX Goes by the glove compartment by passenger seat. Press both sides inward, then the compartment drops down and you will see a black rectangular cover, on the left, pull on the tab and whala. Pull the old air filter out and put the new filter in, make sure you look at the side of the new filter and put air in side with arrow pointing up.
customer_reviews.author: honda_matt

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: I hate to say this because I try not to order from Amazon, they have become a monster. But, the filters feel and look good, they work and cost a lot less than the home auto parts store. I would have loved to buy them locally, but there is a big price difference. Let's see Amazon come out to your car and change a wiper a light bulb for you, for free, when my female friends need something about their cars. For some reason, they never offer to change my wipers when I buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Esme A.

customer_reviews.title: Affordability meets quality
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to install on my 2010 Honda Civic, less than 30 seconds. The quality/pleating is excellent, I replace every 10,000 miles without issue, and the affordable price allows me to easily keep up with maintenance. As for the activated carbon, I still smell outside smells here and there, but it is a civic after all and isn't well insulated like other premium vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Filter
customer_reviews.text: I inherited a vehicle from a family member who was an extremely heavy smoker. Well after a complete detail of the interior and replacement of the cabin filter, the stench of the smoker was gone. This filter was installed before the detail, and was already eliminating the stench and after the detail the stench was gone. I had 3 different Non Smokers ride in the car and none of them could tell that the car had belonged to a smoker. Great product. It actually works
customer_reviews.author: RamDogTango

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive filter
customer_reviews.text: Filter arrived as scheduled - almost(*) perfect fit - works great! No install instructions, but I found a 3-minute Youtube video that was perfect. (It took me longer to empty out all the stuff from the glove compartment than it actually took to remove&replace the filter! ;D ) Wife likes how the car smells now...and I am a fan! (*) - had to use pocketknife to trim off 1/8" excess on one side tab...
customer_reviews.author: Robert Zielazinski

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2nd Gen Ridgeline
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my 2017 Honda Ridgeline and mother-in-law's 2018 Honda Pilot. Seems to be good quality, not sure if the 'activated carbon' coating will actually remove odors from the air. As long as it filters out a lot of the pollen and dust I'm happy. Much better price than Fram and certainly OEM. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: aja2878

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't filter at all - bad fit. Air flows around
customer_reviews.text: You can smell literally everything, every different cars exhaust, that dust storm you drove through, everything. No filtering at all. It may meet required specs (may), but it's clear there's a huge amount of air getting through around the edges
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Perfect timimg
customer_reviews.text: It just so happens that a click ad came up offering this filter amidst wild fires here in California causing terrible air quality. This was the perfect time to change out the cabin filter. There was an immediate difference inside my car. This is a much cheaper option than getting it changed during an oil change at one of those convenient shops where you can pay up to 3 times as much.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Civic cabin filters are easy to install
customer_reviews.text: By far, to any car, Civic's cabin air filter is the easiest to replace! I did it in under 1 minute. The dealer wanted to charge $95-$125 to replace it. Go figure. All you need is drop the glove compartment, push in both sides at the inside, the entire glove compartment drops down but still hanging. Open the filter door and pull out the old filter, it slides out easily and just insert the new one and you are done. So easy.
customer_reviews.author: Yesuaini99

customer_reviews.title: Super saver
customer_reviews.text: At a recent maintenance visit to the dealer, they said I needed to change my cabin air filter. Never even knew I had one. They would charge me $70 to do it. No, thanks. Researched, found a YouTube showing how to install one, and found this on Amazon. Took 5 minutes to install, and I saved over $60. And, yes, the old filter looked gross and needed changing.
customer_reviews.author: cassie

customer_reviews.title: Cost less than $10. Took 5 minutes. Auto interior smell noticeably better.
customer_reviews.text: My review headline says it all. Not much else to say. Purchased a used car and noticed the AC blew air that smelt a little stale. Changed it in less than 5 minutes (used an online video for reference). The filter fit perfectly and had clear indication of air flow direction. Great, quick DIY maintenance task. Don't let the dealers charge you an arm and a leg to do this for you.
customer_reviews.author: Hola

customer_reviews.title: It fits
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance that it would fit my 2018 Honda Accord. Fortunately, a lot of these vehicles don't change details like the filter system much over the years, so it fit fine. I can't really detect how much changing the filter helped, or the superiority of this model over the OEM, but it seems fine, and is a bargain over having a dealer change the filter.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Cabin Filter
customer_reviews.text: The material does not seem durable at all and has a weird industrial plastic smell. I would not recommend this and won’t be putting it in my car.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Orr

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: The package came quickly, the construction and quality is excellent and the fit was perfect for a 2007 Accord. It was quick and easy to change, just opened and emptied the glove box, squeezed the sides toward the middle and removed it. Then looked in and up to find the tray and I think I pinched the sides to remove it and the old filter. Finally I wrote the date and mileage on the new filter and slid it in where the old one was. Good for another year!
customer_reviews.author: EricInWA

customer_reviews.title: Received quickly, fits properly
customer_reviews.text: The filter came very quickly and installation was a breeze. Already searched Youtube on how to install it. VERY simple on Honda Civics. Just do A Youtube search for installing cabin filter on a (model year) Civic ( or whatever model you have) and do it yourself. I hear Honda wants $70 to install this filter! That's INSANE. It takes literally less than 5 minutes to do yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Tommyr

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2006 Honda Civic Hybrid
customer_reviews.text: Fits fine in my 2006 Honda Civic Hybrid and is working as expected. Installation was very easy: Open the glovebox, pull inwards at each stop to allow them to slip though, drop the glovebox door all the way down, and the filter slot is right there, above the fan. On either side of the filter slot are clips, pull them inwards to release them, and pull the filter cartridge out. Pop out the old filter and install the new one, paying attention to the air direction arrows. Slide the filter cartridge back in and close the glovebox. Done!
customer_reviews.author: Techie007

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Change at Good Price
customer_reviews.text: At this price and ease of installation I can change filters more regularly. These work great in my Accord and CRV and allow me to replace when the dust, fertilizer drift, and pollen in this agricultural area get to be overwhelming, Once I got the hang of dropping the glove box, I can replace both filters in 10 minutes without the garage messing up my glove box and charging me many times the price.
customer_reviews.author: vnabob

customer_reviews.title: Healthy Products First
customer_reviews.text: We own two Late Model Honda Accords and always try to replace the cabin Air filter in our cars with K&N long-life, washable cabin air filters. However, K&N has yet to market a cabin air filter for 2018 or 2019 Accords. With one-year on the 2018 Accord filter, there was no better filter choice than the EPAuto Activated carbon filter. The design, price and health benefits of this choice was unmistakable.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and great price
customer_reviews.text: The filter was a perfect fit for my Acura TL I've neglected changing for some time, so I found these on Amazon and gave them a shot. My existing filter was pretty dirty, and probably restricted airflow a bit. My AC seems to blow a bit harder with a clean, new filter in place. It's a solid looking filter and the pricing is great. You save a lot over getting it at the local auto parts stores. I recommend this one and will order again when I need another.
customer_reviews.author: J.L.

customer_reviews.title: there is a small lipstick (~1/4 inch or so) that remains that needs to be trimmer for a perfect fit. Once done
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2014 Odyssey and 2015 Civic and these fit both vehicles. I have found that during the manufacturing, there is a small lipstick (~1/4 inch or so) that remains that needs to be trimmer for a perfect fit. Once done... then the fit is just that, perfect. Despite this one small issue, 5 stars for a good price, especially when bought in quantity. Fluid and filter changes are within the capability of most people, if they're willing. To me, I don't know why your ever pay someone 3-4x the cost of one of these filters to replace them at a auto shop. If you can open your glove box, you about 1/2 way to changing the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Quick ship, great fit
customer_reviews.text: You're gonna need to replace the air filter anyway, so just go ahead and buy two now. These fit perfectly and they're priced so you don't feel bad about discarding them after 15,000 miles (or less). I park my car under a tree, and usually found this filter has trapped leaves, flower, and pollen, so I check (and change) every 90 days or so.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The EPAuto filter was easy to install on my Acura TL
customer_reviews.text: The EPAuto filter was easy to install on my Acura TL, and fits perfectly. I've noticed several benefits: First,the old filter was dirty and the blower motor sounded loud. With this new filter, the noise is gone. Second, the A/C cools better. On hot days the cabin cools faster and stays cool, even when not on the maximum settings. Third, the air is clean and fresh. Not only is this a great product, but it's cheaper than the other brands. I'd definitely recommend the EPAuto filter.
customer_reviews.author: G. Parr

customer_reviews.title: YOU PROBABLY DON'T KNOW YOUR VEHICLE HAS A CABIN AIR FILTER. YOUR DEALER DOES, CHA-CHING CHA-CHING.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these, one for my wife’s CR-V and one for my Pilot. Easy install instructions on the packaging. Also, YouTube videos make this a no brainer. Old filter out, new in...2 minutes. Hardest part was getting my wife to clean out her glove box!—I ain’t touching that!! I think these filters were a little less than $10 ea., so say $20 for two. Check with your dealer how much they want for this service... it's gonna be at least $50 each vehicle. So I saved $80 or more for maybe 20 minutes of work, all inclusive of ordering, unpacking, YouTubing, and install. Finally, these filters do get gunked up so change is good.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon S

customer_reviews.title: Great price, fits perfectly, easy installation
customer_reviews.text: Replacing the air filter is super easy, anyone can do it in less than 5 minutes. Not sure how an average user like me can know if this does what it is supposed to without going through actually air quality tests. For the peace of mind though, it is worth it compared to spending 3 times the price the dealer charges it. I've just decided to change it every 6 months without thinking and going to continue to do so. Fits perfectly for my Honda Accord 2017 LX
customer_reviews.author: Amyn Virani

customer_reviews.title: Number of pleats was 29 just like the advertised picture
customer_reviews.text: Fit well into the filter holder, no trimming or adjust meant needed. Visibly contains carbon layered between two filter papers. Number of pleats was 29 just like the advertised picture. The original Honda NON-activated carbon filter had 44 pleats. I'm assuming with the layering of carbon you can't fit as many pleats in, so that is just fine. The original had somewhat more rigid sides, but it really makes no difference since it sits in a plastic cartridge anyway. Good product, i would get this this again.
customer_reviews.author: Wasabi

customer_reviews.title: Carbon Activated Auto Cabin Filters
customer_reviews.text: I bought these EPAtuto cabin filters for my wife's 2010 Honda Civic. These filters appear to be better than the Honda paper filter, because they include carbon. The carbon should help in absorbing any orders in the cabin. The cabin filter is very easy to install and there are several YouTube videos that show you how remove the old filter and how to install a new one. It's literally takes only 5 to 10 minutes to change out the filter. Each filter is expected to last for one year.
customer_reviews.author: eZorro

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2011 Honda Accord Coupe V6
customer_reviews.text: Skill level: Novice Tools required: none. I am a girl and did this by myself in a jiffy. This is easier to change than newer cars with plastic knobs. If you have never done it before, YT a few clips. There are many good videos that walks you through step by step.
customer_reviews.author: JuneClover

customer_reviews.title: Easy replacement & works great
customer_reviews.text: No tools needed for 03 Honda Accord. Take all your stuff out of the glove box. Push back to pop the little arm on the right ride off. The squeeze the glove box and at the same time pull down. It will fall down and out of the way. You will see the compartment that the filter goes in and you push the clips in then pull out the tray. Replace it and then reverse the steps. Make sure the air flow matches the tray direction
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Jones

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install! However, keep in mind that the orientation of the folding is different compared to the OEM but this does not impact the functionality of the part nor does it affect the installation as the dimensions are just right. No problems with it so far. In terms of life time I am not sure how it will stack up to the OEM part, but I will update it in 8 months. It's hard to say how much better the air quality is, but the price was very reasonable!
customer_reviews.author: Yayita

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit 2013 Accord
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd one of these I've ordered, they fit perfectly and do not impede the air flow; yet they do catch quite a bit of dust, bugs, and other small bits. Odorless, no perfume smell. Go to utube for video if you are unsure how to install. Significant savings over Honda filter, can get 3 for the price of one sold by dealerships.
customer_reviews.author: A. McAvoy

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: Fast easy install. Fast ship. Decent quality. Rally can tell the difference in quality of air coming into my car cabin. Took only 2 min to install. ANYONE can do it. Save your money and DONT let the dealership charge $40 to $70 for this. Lots of YouTube vids to show you. A++ for product. Glad I replaced mine after 29 months of my OEM stock one being in there.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and High Quality
customer_reviews.text: This cabin filter fits my 2007 Honda CR-V. The filter is a necessity because it cleans the air that passes through the ac evaporator and prevents accumulation of debris that could clog the evaporator tray drain hose and cause water to drip onto the carpet. It installs behind the glove compartment door and is easy to replace.
customer_reviews.author: BookwormX

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: When my neighbor was replacing my air filter, he mentioned the cabin air filter should be replaced as well. I had never even heard of a cabin air filter! I found this one of Amazon, the price was right and liked the description. Order came in two days, watched a YouTube video on how to replace it on my 2010 Honda Odyssey, seemed easy enough. Replaced with no issues, perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: J T

customer_reviews.title: Price is right, exact fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for the OE filter that came in the car. There are generic instructions on the box, enough to know what to do. Price is right. And good fit for my Honda. I’m not sure in terms of airflow is the same as an OE if it’s better (might actually be more restrictive because it has activated carbon) , but it works
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Easy do it yourself maintenance!!
customer_reviews.text: Another Easy do it yourself maintenance item. If you are unsure of the location of your Cabin filter, search the web. There are lots of videos out there to walk you through. We elected the subribsruption to drop off new filters every 6mo. Don't waste your money at the dealership. 3 min replacement.
customer_reviews.author: imjoedaddy

customer_reviews.title: Poor Construction
customer_reviews.text: Filter was poorly constructed. Once installed there was a gap at the top (see picture) that would allow unfiltered air to pass thus negating the effectiveness of the filter.
customer_reviews.author: T. M. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation, perfect fit in my 08 odyssey
customer_reviews.text: So glad I decided to buy this because I didn’t realize this wasn’t part of regular maintenance when I take my car in. The old filter was gross and replacing it couldn’t have been easier. The new filter did not have as many pleats as the original, but it can’t be worse than what I had, and now I know to change it regularly, so I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Moon

customer_reviews.title: Clean air is a good thing
customer_reviews.text: We live in fire country CA, where the air isn't always the best and the road are mostly 4-6 lanes with plenty of other cars on them. These are a little piece of mind during all the driving we do day in day out, week in week out, etc. Small price to pay for clean air. Invest in yourself.
customer_reviews.author: G. Strout

customer_reviews.title: Great filter option
customer_reviews.text: I have to take off a star for the fitment. The filter sits in a plastic support before sliding into place (07 Civic). The way it fits is great, but there are tabs that are supposed to hold the filter paper on two sides and mine weren't quite wide enough to seal completely. It's a small gap, but it is supposed to filter the entire duct. Still way worth it to spend 1/4 the OEM price.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: This does NOT fit a 2004 Honda CRV
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure how to rate this. My dissatisfaction is mostly due to my own stupidity I did not read the fine print about which years of CRV this filter fit into. It is exactly 2 times too big for a 2004 CRV. However, it was not really worth returning, so I cut the filter in half (painstakingly) and re-glued the edge back on. Fits perfectly into our 2004 after surgery. Caveat emptor.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: watch out for acorns and pine needles
customer_reviews.text: I watched a video on youtube for how to get the glove compartment off. Simple to do. However, nobody warned me of debris falling into the blower. Acorns and dry leaves and pine needles had fallen into my blower and now i have a very noisy fan. I was able to get most of the debris out but it is still a noisy blower now.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Works for my 08 mugen
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace mine in my 08 Mugen Si, as it was nasty. This one does have a lesser amount of pleats, but it seems to do the job. Definitely noticed an increase in the amount of AC I got into the cabin. Has a “clean” smell that’llbe there the first few times you use the AC/heat, but it’s not a bad smell or anything. Smells like a fresh filter (obviously) Great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Problems
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be a really good product. It was super easy to install in my Honda Odyssey. The old one I removed was really dirty after only 25000 miles. So my review is based more on the simplicity of the installation than the product. Just find a video of installation for your particular vehicle. Some are easier than others.
customer_reviews.author: M. Higgs

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and quaility
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy low quality to save a few bucks but these are even better than Fram and for only $7 bucks well worth the money. You can afford to change them twice as often at this price. Hard to belive they get this dirty. Using in Honda's. I am impressed with EPAuto quality and will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Who’d a-thought this could make that much difference?
customer_reviews.text: Once I got enough light into the back of the glovebox to see what I was doing, it was simple to install (ProTip, an LED headlamp is a great investment). The old filter was filthy and appeared to have been installed upside down. There’s a noticeable difference in airflow; I’d been thinking about asking my mechanic to check the a/c, but now it’s fine. I’ll definitely change this filter annually from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Pieter B

customer_reviews.title: Arrived as promised,  very good filter, and cheapest place I have found.
customer_reviews.text: I like the product very much. It arrived quickly and well package, although the box had damage the filter wasn't harmed. I'm a 71 year old female and once I figured out how to install it fit perfectly. I will order it again from Amazon when the filter requires a new one. Much cheaper than I've found in my area.
customer_reviews.author: doris

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, but fewer pleats may not be as effective.
customer_reviews.text: Not as many pleats as Genuine Honda cabin air filter, so may not be as effective. That said, it fit fine and was very easy to install. 2-minute job. See a YouTube video. While this is probably a good buy, next time I will spend a bit more and get the Genuine Honda (available thru Amazon).
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Honda Accord perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This is relatively easy to install on the Honda although you have to empty your glove compartment. The added bonus is that I got to clean out my glove compartment at the same time I replaced my cabin filter. The filter looks to be of good quality and it is simple to replace which can save you a few dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S.

customer_reviews.title: 2013 Honda Odyssey perfect fit OEM Quality
customer_reviews.text: Do not have the dealer change this out. They wanted $125 for both air and cabin filters. Both this brand of filters combined were under $20. And they are identical to the generic Honda brand. Took me longer to clean my glove compartment than it did to change them out. Great fit for 2013 Honda Odyssey.
customer_reviews.author: rbalster

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal!
customer_reviews.text: Great deal for a replacement cabin air filter. Previously used a FRAM and even though this filter does have less pleats I don't think it will make that much of a filtration difference. For the price, I would be able to change it twice in on year compared to buying the FRAM which I probably still won't but I'm just saying. Used on a 2013 Honda Accord Sedan EX.
customer_reviews.author: Duy Tran

customer_reviews.title: A Fraction of the Dealer Price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2015 Honda Odyssey, where the dealer wanted approximately $70 to replace this filter. I bought this, watched a YouTube video, and was done in about two minutes. Works at least as well as the OEM part. This is one car repair ANYONE can do themselves and the return on investment is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A.

customer_reviews.title: It works and now I have clean air moving throughout my car cabin.
customer_reviews.text: I had to Youtube how to replace the filter in my car because I've never done it before, but this product perfectly replaces the old filter in my Honda Accord. I am happy to make this purchase and the 3-pack is the best deal you can get on these things. Easy to installation as well. You can't go wrong with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Horatio

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to replace
customer_reviews.text: Instead of paying up to $45 for your local oil change place or at the dealer, just buy the right one for your car and do it yourself. This goes by lowering the glove compartment and pulling out the old one. There are plenty of youtube videos on how to do this depending on your make and model.
customer_reviews.author: shrewst

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but Seemingly Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've used these filters in my 2016 Odyssey and my 2013 Accord. Installation is a bit of a pain, as they are located behind the glove box, but it's not too difficult. (I suggest looking at a Youtube video.) It's amazing that Amazon can offer products like this at such a low price. My local Honda dealer charges $60 to replace this filter.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Lock

customer_reviews.title: Fit 2006 Civic perfectly...Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: I looked at an installation video on You-Tube, but there were also pretty clear instructions on the box. It took me about five minutes to install, including sorting and rearranging the contents of the glove box. I am attaching a photo of the charges the Honda dealer wanted to do this job. I saved $90.99 in five minutes. Woohoo!
customer_reviews.author: Booklover

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive replacement
customer_reviews.text: The Honda dealer quoted me $175.00 to replace this filter. So for just pennies I bought and installed this filter myself. It is fairly easy to install. One can go to YouTube for a demonstration. This filter is high quality. I noticed the difference of airflow in the cabin after installation. I recommend it highly
customer_reviews.author: John J. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: Appears better than OEM. Much cheaper and easy to install on our Odyssey. Don't ever let the dealer charge you $100 to change it.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Wandel

customer_reviews.title: Great price for quality product
customer_reviews.text: Bought and had my son install. I was scheduled for an oil change and knew they would ask to change it. Knowing they how much they charge to do it, having my son do it for me saved me money. It is comparable or better than what has been previously installed by professionals, and took him less than 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: adammichael

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit- great price
customer_reviews.text: It literally took 2 minutes to change this on my wife's RDX. 1. Squeeze the glove box towards the back so it drops past normal open position. [push plastic stop/catch on r/s forward] 2. push 2 tabs on filter drawer- pull out/ change filter [note "air flow" direction arrows on components] 3. push filter drawer back in until tabs click- lift glove box back up and re-latch stop/catch lever. Done!
customer_reviews.author: Richard F.

customer_reviews.title: Wow! What a Savings.
customer_reviews.text: The Honda dealership wanted $60.00 to replace my cabin air filter. Instead, I purchased your filter for $8 and change, watched a 2.5 minute "how to" video on youtube on where and how to change the filter and then changed it in approximately 5 minutes. No tools are required and the video clearly showed how to drop the glove box door, exposing the filter. The removal and replacement was simple enough for anyone with zero mechanical skills to do the job. Additionally, the replacement air filter appears to be of much higher quality than the OEM filter I removed. THANKS for what appears to be a great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: T. Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly in Honda CRV 2015 and is easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly in my Honda CRV 2015. Very easy to install. The dealer wanted to charge me $79 for this part. While it was an original Honda filter, I can't imagine it's that much of a difference. Ultimately it does the same job. This filter isn't flimsy so it slides into its place easily. If you're having trouble following the written instructions, there are great videos on you tube that are extremely helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good filter for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Went to my local auto shop they junky had a few options for cabin air filters for my girlfriend a car, a 2015 Honda Accord, and when I looked up reviews of the filters the ratings were not very good, so I went on amazon and I found this filter half the cost of the cheapest filter they had at the store and with a great rating, so no brained i ordered it and I’m so glad I did
customer_reviews.author: K. Pimsakul

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality at at great price!
customer_reviews.text: I had stopped at my local auto store and bought air cabinet filter for our car. It was so expensive and I got on the internet to see which ones were rated the highest and how much they cost. Well, these highly rated and ended up being just about half the cost of what I had bought. I ordered this three-pack and returned the other. These came very quickly and were easy to put in and I am one happy customer! Now I know where to order the next time. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Watch Youtube video for installation instruction
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived promptly and was the same size as the one installed by the dealership. Filter is a grayish color (instead of white), so at first I thought it was dirty; the color shouldn't affect the performance. Installed in same position as dirty filter but couldn't get the filter compartment closed. Watched a couple of YouTube videos before realizing that the dealership had installed the filter incorrectly; we had to rotate the filter 90 degrees before the filter compartment would close! Now we know.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary

customer_reviews.title: Do it yourself ...
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how much dealers want to charge to change these out! Although I'm not mechanically inclined, I looked up on you tube how to change this, and I did it myself! I had no idea that the cabin air filter was behind the glove box, and would have had no idea how to change this. Changing the cabin air filter was actually easier than changing the engine oil filter (because mechanics had tightened the bolts/screws too tightly -- took me forever to get those off!). The product fit perfectly in my car, and saved me money by doing it myself!
customer_reviews.author: Cyndy

product_meta.title: EPAuto CP134 (CF10134) Premium Cabin Air Filter includes Activated Carbon
product_meta.description:
Item Package Quantity:1

EPAuto Cabin Air Filter Provides clean air for driver and passengers, contains soda and carbon to generate fresh breeze air.

Compatible with Select Models list:



 * Acura: * CSX (2007-2011)
    * ILX (2013-2019)
    * MDX (2007-2019)
    * RDX (2007-2018) 
    * RL (2005-2012)
    * RLX (2014-2019)
    * TL (2004-2014)
    * TLX (2015-2019)
    * TSX (2004-2014)
    * ZDX (2010-2013)
   
   
 * Honda: * Accord (2003-2019)
    * Accord Crosstour (2010-2011)
    * Civic (2006-2015)
    * Crosstour (2012-2015)
    * CR-V (2007-2016)
    * Odyssey (2005-2017)
    * Passport (2019)
    * Pilot (2009-2019)
    * Ridgeline (2006-2019)
   
   



Cross Reference:



 * HONDA: 80292-SDA-A01, 80292-SDC-A01, 80292-SEC-A01, 80292-SHJ-A41, 80292-SWA-A01, 80292-T0G-A01, 80292-TZ5-A41
 * FRAM: CF10134
 * AC-DELCO: CF159
 * BALDWIN: PA4196
 * BECK/ARNLEY: 042-2019 042-2023
 * BOSCH: P3875
 * CHAMP: CAF1781
 * DEFENSE: DC058
 * DELPHI: 16458329
 * G K INDUSTRIES: CF1047
 * HASTINGS: AF1244, AFC1244
 * INTERCONTINENTAL AUTO PARTS: ALC-5302/1
 * KLEENER : CAF1781
 * LUBER-FINER: CAF1781
 * NAPA: 4815
 * PARTS MASTER: 94815
 * PRONTO: PC-5519
 * PUROLATOR: C35519
 * SERVICE PRO: MC35519
 * STP: CAF1781
 * WIX: 24815
feature_bullets: Clean air for driver and passengers, contains soda and carbon to generate fresh breeze air.
Replacement for FRAM CF10134, Honda Genuine part # 80292-SDA-A01, 80292-SDC-A01, 80292-SEC-A01, 80292-SHJ-A41, 80292-SWA-A01, 80292-T0G-A01, 80292-TZ5-A41.

Compatible with Select Model Honda : Accord (2003-2019), Accord Crosstour (2010-2011), Civic (2006-2015), Crosstour (2012-2015), CR-V (2007-2016), Odyssey (2005-2017), Passport (2019), Pilot (2009-2019), Ridgeline (2006-2019)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars10,864 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
